hero.question: Will Trump nominate Judy Shelton as the next Fed chair?
hero.prob_take: The market is pricing Shelton in at 3.6% after a brutal 46-point collapse in the last day, suggesting traders have basically written her off as Trump's pick. Watch if any Fed vacancy signals or Trump statements reignite her chances, because her hyperinflation-hawk positions remain a lightning rod for the financial establishment.

daily_take.headline: Shelton's Fed Dreams Crash Hard on Political Reality
daily_take.deck: Judy Shelton's odds of becoming the next Fed chair collapsed 46 points in 24 hours, landing at a near-terminal 3.6%. The plunge reflects what markets already knew: nominating a gold-standard hawk with a track record of controversial statements remains political poison, even for a Republican president. When $96M of volume agrees she's a long shot, she's a long shot.
